title: Appeal to emotion
content:
Using emotions instead of facts to persuade.
Example: "If you don't support this policy, you're not a patriot."

title: Begging the question
content:
Assuming the conclusion in the premise.\n
Example: "God exists because the Bible says so, and the Bible is the word of God."

title: Middle ground fallacy
content: Assuming that the middle point between two extremes is always the best solution.	"The solution to climate change is to compromise between the people who want to do nothing and the people who want to shut down all industry."
